title: Jaws 50th Anniversary Screenings
description: Stephen Spielberg’s 1975 blockbuster resurfaces for its 50th anniversary, with screenings in 4K, digital 3D, and IMAX.

title: 16th Annual NYC Unicycle Festival
description: The New York City Unicycle Festival rolls back into town for four days of one-wheeled fun. This year’s fest kicks off with long-distance rides on Thursday and Friday, then pulls up to Hudson River Park’s Pier 76 (Midtown West) on Saturday and Sunday with a learn-to-ride area for newbies, exhibitions, and games like unicycle basketball and hockey.
address: Hudson River Park’s Pier 76, Midtown West

title: Abolish Everything: A Fast-Paced, Low-Stakes Comedy Debate Show
description: Comedians roast their pet peeves, a panel of improvisers grills them with questions, and the audience decides what gets abolished. Hosted by Chandler Dean.

title: Free Outdoor Movies: Mamma Mia!
description: Outdoor movie screening of 'Mamma Mia!' at Pier I at Riverside Park South (UWS).
address: Pier I at Riverside Park South, UWS

title: Free Outdoor Movies: Miss Congeniality
description: Outdoor movie screening of 'Miss Congeniality' at Prospect Park.

title: Free Outdoor Movies: Summer of Soul
description: Outdoor movie screening of 'Summer of Soul' at Tompkins Square Park (LES).

title: Free Outdoor Movies: Wish
description: Outdoor movie screening of 'Wish' at Courtney Callender Playground (Harlem).

title: Reading 101
description: Writers Alexis Nowicki and Maria Robins-Somerville debut Reading 101, a new literary series at Night Club 101 (East Village). Each event features five readers across genres sharing five-minute excerpts, followed by a DJ set and party.

title: Letters + Sodas: LIC Reading Series
description: Writer Lana Schwartz brings together comedians and writers for a night of standup, humor pieces, fiction, and essay readings at The Greats of Craft (LIC).

title: Summerstage: Morgan Freeman's Symphonic Blues Experience
description: Go on a journey through the history of the delta blues as Morgan Freeman's Symphonic Blues Experience blends live blues and orchestral performances with narration filmed on location at Morgan Freeman’s Ground Zero Blues Club in Mississippi.

title: We Have Fun: A Stand-Up Show
description: Hosts Zach Sims and Dan Wilbur team up to bring the fun-ny to Young Ethel’s (South Slope), with stand-up by Dave Ross, Ali O’Neil, Rob Cantrell, and Josh Rabin.

title: The Moth Storyslam
description: The popular community-based open mic storytelling competition, where anyone can share a five-minute tale based on the evening’s theme to an attentive audience, returns to The Bell House (Gowanus). Tonight’s theme: ‘gumption.’

title: Constellation Prize: An Astrology-Based Comedy Game Show
description: Stand-up meets the stars at Constellation Prize, a show where comedians perform short three-minute sets—then a panel of astrologers try to guess their zodiac sign. An open mic follows.

title: Rooftop Films Presents: Mistress Dispeller
description: The popular rooftop films series, one of the world’s longest-running and largest outdoor showcases for indie film, returns for its 29th season. Tonight: Elizabeth Lo’s 'Mistress Dispeller', followed by an afterparty.
address: The Old American Can Factory, Gowanus

title: The Metropolitan Opera Summer HD Festival
description: The Met’s 16th summer HD festival features free outdoor screenings of the company’s live in HD opera series productions. Held at Lincoln Center’s Josie Robertson Plaza with seating for 2,500, screenings are rain or shine, but will be canceled in the event of thunder, lightning, or high wind.

title: Free Outdoor Movies: Battle of the Sexes
description: Outdoor movie screening of 'Battle of the Sexes' at the Rooftop at Pier 17 (Lower Manhattan).

title: Free Outdoor Movies: Big Hero 6
description: Outdoor movie screening of 'Big Hero 6' at Cadman Plaza Park (Brooklyn Heights).

title: Free Outdoor Movies: La La Land
description: Outdoor movie screening of 'La La Land' at Bella Abzug Park (Hell’s Kitchen).

title: Free Outdoor Movies: Teenage Mutant Ninja Turtles: Mutant Mayhem and Ocean's 8
description: Outdoor movie screening of 'Teenage Mutant Ninja Turtles: Mutant Mayhem' and 'Ocean's 8' at Domino Park (Williamsburg).

title: We Love a Theme: A Storytelling Show
description: A lineup of performers tell funny, heartwarming, and cringe-inducing tales at Bailey Swilley’s monthly storytelling show. Tonight’s ‘burned’ theme features Calvin Cato, Adam Selbst, Wes Hazard, and Carly Ciarrochi.

title: Live Band Karaoke at Arlene’s Grocery
description: Choose from a wide assortment of rock and pop songs and take the stage with your very own live band (Nakatomi5) backing you up.
